required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 14, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Post-COVID-Health Study: Multidimensional Health Status of COVID-19 Survivors One Year After a SARS-CoV-2 Infection
clinical_study.official_title: Post-COVID-Health Study: Multidimensional Health Status of COVID-19 Survivors One Year After a SARS-CoV-2 Infection

brief_summary.textblock: This study assesses the multidimensional health status of COVID-19 survivors one-year post-infection using validated subjective and objective measures.

detailed_description.textblock:
Rationale: Within the Netherlands, more than 1 million people have been infected with SARS-CoV-2, also known as COVID-19. Although the mortality rate is considerable, the vast majority of COVID-19 patients survive the infection. Preliminary findings show that a majority of COVID-19 survivors still experience health problems 3 months after the infection, including reduced lung diffusion capacity, low exercise capacity, muscle weakness, mental problems and reduced cognitive function resulting in a generally poor health status. Whether these health consequences persist on the long-term is unknown.
Objective: To assess the multidimensional health status of COVID-19 survivors one-year post-infection using validated subjective and objective measures.
Study design: A multicenter prospective observational study performed within the MUMC+ and VieCuri Medical Center.
Study population: 125 COVID-19 survivors of the MUMC+ or VieCuri Medical Center, both hospitalized (ICU and non-ICU admitted) as well as non-hospitalized patients.
Main study parameters/endpoints: Outcome parameters include objectively and subjectively measured multidimensional health outcomes including physiological and metabolic health, physical capability, cognitive function, psychosocial well-being, social well-being, patient reported outcomes as well as potential determinants of these multidimensional health outcomes (e.g. treatment during/after SARS-CoV-2 infection, vaccination, comorbidities, medication use etc.). Outcomes will be measured during a one-day study visit.
Nature and extent of the burden and risks associated with participation, benefit and group relatedness: Subjects will benefit from participating within this study, because their general health will be evaluated in detail and from a multidimensional perspective. Furthermore, subjects will be informed on their multidimensional health outcomes and will receive a lifestyle advice tailored to their health status. Risks and inconveniences are limited to the time investment associated with the completion of the questionnaires and the study visit. During the study visit various non-invasive measurements as well as minor invasive blood sampling will be performed.

primary_outcome.measure: Lung function measured with spirometry
primary_outcome.description: Pre- and post-bronchodilator spirometry will be performed to determine forced vital capacity (FVC) and forced expiratory volume in 1 second (FEV1).

primary_outcome.measure: Diffusion capacity measured with the single breath method
primary_outcome.description: To determine diffusion capacity for carbon monoxide

primary_outcome.measure: Bone mineral density by dual-energy X-ray (DEXA)-scan
primary_outcome.description: Total bone mineral density (BMD) as well as BMD of the lumbar spine and total hip-neck will be determined using a DEXA-scan.

primary_outcome.measure: Lean mass by dual-energy X-ray (DEXA)-scan
primary_outcome.description: Total lean mass will be determined using a DEXA-scan.

primary_outcome.measure: Fat free mass by dual-energy X-ray (DEXA)-scan
primary_outcome.description: Total fat free mass will be measured using a DEXA-scan.

primary_outcome.measure: Fat mass by dual-energy X-ray (DEXA)-scan
primary_outcome.description: Total fat mass and fat percentage as well as visceral fat mass will be measured using a DEXA-scan.

primary_outcome.measure: Vertebral fracture assessment by dual-energy X-ray (DEXA-scan)
primary_outcome.description: Vertebral fracture assessment will be determined using a DEXA-scan.

primary_outcome.measure: Weight will be measured on a weighing scale
primary_outcome.description: Weight will be measured on a weighing scale.

primary_outcome.measure: Height will be measured using a stadiometer
primary_outcome.description: Height will be measured using a stadiometer.

primary_outcome.measure: Body mass index (BMI) will be calculated from the weight and height
primary_outcome.description: Weight and height will be combined to report BMI in (kg/m^2)

primary_outcome.measure: Fasted resting energy expenditure by indirect calorimetry (ventilated hood)
primary_outcome.description: VO2 and VCO2 will be measured to determine energy expenditure.

primary_outcome.measure: Resting blood pressure
primary_outcome.description: Resting diastolic and systolic blood pressure will be measured as part of the cardiometabolic profile to determine the prevalence of the metabolic syndrome.

primary_outcome.measure: Waist circumference
primary_outcome.description: Waist circumference will be measured as part of the cardiometabolic profile to determine the prevalence of the metabolic syndrome.

primary_outcome.measure: Fasting glucose levels
primary_outcome.description: Fasting glucose levels will be determined in sampled blood as part of the cardiometabolic profile to determine the prevalence of the metabolic syndrome.

primary_outcome.measure: Fasted lipid profile
primary_outcome.description: Fasted high-density, low-density and total lipoprotein levels (HDL and LDL) as well as triglycerides will be measured as part of the cardiometabolic profile to determine the prevalence of the metabolic syndrome.

primary_outcome.measure: Six minute walking test to determine exercise capacity
primary_outcome.description: Six minute walking distance will be determined.

primary_outcome.measure: Peak work rate by cardiopulmonary cycling exercise test (CPET)
primary_outcome.description: Maximal work rate (W) will be determined during the CPET

primary_outcome.measure: Peak O2-consumption and CO2-production by cardiopulmonary cycling exercise test (CPET)
primary_outcome.description: Maximal O2 consumption and CO2 production will be determined during the CPET.

primary_outcome.measure: Maximal heart rate during cardiopulmonary cycling exercise test (CPET)
primary_outcome.description: Maximal heart will be measured during the CPET.

primary_outcome.measure: Respiratory muscle strength by mouth pressure
primary_outcome.description: Inspiratory and expiratory mouth pressure will be measured.

primary_outcome.measure: Upper extremity muscle strength by measuring handgrip strength
primary_outcome.description: A hydraulic grip strength dynamometer will be used to measure the maximal handgrip strength.

primary_outcome.measure: Lower extremity muscle strength by measuring isometric muscle strength
primary_outcome.description: Maximal isometric upper leg muscle strength will be measured of the quadriceps muscle using a Biodex dynamometer.

primary_outcome.measure: Mobility using the short physical performance battery (SPPB)
primary_outcome.description: The SPPB consists of three types of physical maneuvers: the balance test, the gait speed test and the chair stand test leading to a score of 0-12. Lower scores indicate less mobility.

primary_outcome.measure: Physical activity level by accelerometry
primary_outcome.description: An accelerometer will be worn for 7 days to determine physical activity level.

primary_outcome.measure: Cognitive function by Montreal Cognitive Assessment (MOCA)
primary_outcome.description: The MOCA will lead to a total score of 0-30, in which lower scores indicate less cognitive function.

primary_outcome.measure: Dietary intake by a food diary
primary_outcome.description: A 3-day food diary will be used to investigate the dietary intake.

primary_outcome.measure: Smell by the Sniffing Sticks treshold test
primary_outcome.description: The average of the last four reversal points is used as final threshold score.

primary_outcome.measure: Taste using the taste strips 'filter paper disc method' test
primary_outcome.description: A maximum score of 16 correct taste detections can be retrieved indication good taste function.

primary_outcome.measure: Taste and smell function using the taste and smell function questionnaire
primary_outcome.description: The questionnaire will retrieve a maximal score of 0-52 and 0-44 for taste and smell, respectively, in which higher scores indicate problems with taste and smell function.

primary_outcome.measure: The hospital anxiety and depression scale (HADS) to determine anxiety and depression levels
primary_outcome.description: The HADS will retrieve a total score of 0-21 in which lower levels indicate higher levels of anxiety or depression.

primary_outcome.measure: The Perceived stress scale (PSS) to determine stress levels
primary_outcome.description: The PSS will retrieve a total score of 0-40 in which lower scores indicate higher stress levels.

primary_outcome.measure: Perceived social support using the multidimensional scale of perceived social support (MSPSS)
primary_outcome.description: A total score of 12-84 can be retrieved in which lower scores indicate lower levels of social support.

primary_outcome.measure: Loneliness using the loneliness scale (LS)
primary_outcome.description: The LS will retrieve a total score of 0-11 in which higher scores indicate strong loneliness.

primary_outcome.measure: Subjective multidimensional health status by euroqol-5 dimensions
primary_outcome.description: The EQ-5D consists of 5 domains (mobility, self-care, usual activity, pain/discomfort, anxiety/depression) and a visual analogue scale.

primary_outcome.measure: Dyspnea using the modified medical research council (mMRC)
primary_outcome.description: The mMRC will retrieve a total score of 0-5 in which higher levels indicate more dyspnea.

primary_outcome.measure: Fatigue using the Checklist Individual Strength (CIS)
primary_outcome.description: The CIS will retrieve a total score of 20-140 in which higher scores indicate more fatigue.

primary_outcome.measure: Sleep quality using the Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index (PSQI)
primary_outcome.description: The total PSQI score will vary between 0-21 in which higher scores indicate poor sleep quality.

primary_outcome.measure: General pain using the Visual Analogue Scale (VAS)
primary_outcome.description: A total score of 0-100 will be retrieved in which higher scores indicate more pain.

secondary_outcome.description: Retrieved from medical records and self-report
Retrieved from medical records and self-report
Retrieved from medical records and self-report
Retrieved from medical records and self-report
Retrieved from medical records and self-report

secondary_outcome.measure: Muscle and adipose tissue cross sectional area (CSA) on chest-CT scan
secondary_outcome.description: Only in case a chest-CT scan has been obtained during screening for SARS-CoV-2 which meets the requirements for reliable extrapulmonary quantifications of muscle and adipose tissue cross sectional area (CSA), an additional chest-CT will be obtained to assess changes on CT-derived muscle and adipose tissue. In case no chest-CT scan was obtained during screening for SARS-CoV-2, no chest-CT scan will be performed during the study visit. Muscle and adipose tissue CSA will be determined based on pre-established thresholds of Hounsfield units.

secondary_outcome.measure: Persistent lung damage on chest-CT scan
secondary_outcome.description: Only in case a chest-CT scan has been obtained during screening for SARS-CoV-2 which meets the requirements for reliable extrapulmonary quantifications of muscle and adipose tissue cross sectional area, an additional chest-CT will be obtained to assess changes on CT-derived lung tissue. In case no chest-CT scan was obtained during screening for SARS-CoV-2, no chest-CT scan will be performed during the study visit. Persistent lung damage will be determined by a trained radiologist.

other_outcome.description: Including age, gender, race, living situation, household composition, marital status, educational level, smoking status, alcohol consumed, employment status, occupation, volunteer work, and income level.

other_outcome.measure: Motivation by the Behavioral Regulation in Exercise Questionnaire (BREQ-2)
other_outcome.description: The BREQ-2 will provide several motivation types based on the self-determination theory.

other_outcome.measure: Motivation by the Regulation of Eating Behaviors Questionnaire (REBS)
other_outcome.description: The REBS will provide several motivation types based on the self-determination theory.

study_pop.textblock: All COVID-19 survivors of the MUMC+ or VieCuri Medical Center can be included in this study. Both hospitalized (ICU and non-ICU admitted) as well as non-hospitalized patients will be eligible for participation. Patients infected during the first wave as well as during the second wave can be included.
